translation: poprzednik, okoliczność poprzedzająca [formal; a thing or an event that exists or comes before another, and may have influenced it]
sentence: The book dealt with the historical antecedents of the Civil War.

translation: pożytek, korzyść [use, purpose, advantage, or profit]
sentence: We tried to persuade her not to resign, but to no avail.

translation: pożądliwy, chciwy, zazdrosny [formal disapproving; wanting to have something too much, especially something that belongs to someone else]
sentence: I can't help casting covetous looks at my neighbour's new Porsche.

translation: wymyślać, obmyślać [to invent a plan, system, object, etc., usually using your intelligence or imagination]
sentence: He's good at devising language games that you can play with students in class.

translation: motywować, zachęcać [to encourage someone to behave in a particular way by offering them a reward]
sentence: You need to incentivize your existing customers to stay with you.

translation: przezroczysty [clearly expressed and easily understood; literary; clear and transparent]
sentence: His prose style is flexible, limpid, and a great pleasure to read.

translation: chlew [an enclosed area where pigs are kept; a dirty or messy place]
społeczność (też: pospólstwo) [the ordinary people who live in a particular country or place]
sentence: Some studies show that workers in the nuclear industry are more likely than the general populace to get cancer.

translation: błąkać się, wędrować [to move or travel around an area, especially a large one]
sentence: He spent most of his life roving the world in search of his fortune.

translation: nieprawdopodobny, niesamowity [strange or mysterious; difficult or impossible to explain]
sentence: He has an uncanny ability to pick a winner.
